ETYMOLOGY: From sulfur (or sulphur) + -ate, indicating a salt or ester of an acid. Ultimately from Latin sulfur 'brimstone'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A salt or ester of sulfuric acid, typically occurring as a crystalline solid. Many sulphates are common minerals.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 硫酸的盐或酯，通常为结晶固体。许多硫酸盐是常见的矿物质。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Magnesium sulphate, commonly known as Epsom salts, can be used as a laxative.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 硫酸镁，俗称泻盐，可用作泻药。
